page.title: 12Transport
page.content: Transport to and from the island is dependent on the ferry service run by Caledonian MacBrayne. Boats run three times a week and four times during the summer. Tuesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays in winter, and Monday, Wednesday, Friday & Saturday in the summer. The MV.Claymore does the winter run and the MV.Columba does the summer run. Loganair run an air ambulance service if required to take medical emergancies to hospital in Glasgow. From time to time private aeroplanes and helicopters call at the island, but there is no regular air service. there is no form of public transport on the island, the uslanders are dependant on thier own vehicls, bicycles, motor bikes,cars,tractors etc.
